text:
“Sopranos” star Jamie-Lynn Sigler’s eldest brother Adam Sigler has tragically died after a sudden brain hemorrhage.

Adam — a treasury operations specialist at Fidelity Investments in New Jersey — passed away on Wednesday after suffering from a brain aneurysm last Friday at his home on the Upper East Side.

Adam, 41, who grew up in Jericho, LI, was the oldest of the three Sigler children, including middle brother Brian. He was engaged to real estate broker Danielle Piro, whom he’d been with for six years.

A family friend told us that Adam would “light up a room, make everyone laugh and was always in for a good time,” and that he and Jamie, 33, had always been very close and he’d always been very supportive of her acting career.

The friend added that Adam was an “incredible uncle and was loved by all his nieces and nephews. There was no one sweeter, kinder and more full of energy and spirit. There will be a hole in all our lives forever. Anyone who had the chance to be around Adam should be considered lucky.”

“Jamie-Lynn, along with her family, is thankful for everyone’s love and support.”

We’re told that Adam’s death was sudden and he had shown no previous signs of health problems. He was found at home by his fiancée after suffering the hemorrhage.

The friend added that the whole Sigler family was with Adam during his coma and at his bedside when he passed. A private family funeral will be held Sunday on Long Island.

Jamie-Lynn, who is engaged to Cutter Dykstra, with whom she has a 1-year-old son, Beau Kyle, reportedly changed her private Facebook photo to a picture of herself and Adam earlier this week.

“My thoughts and prayers are with you and your family, Jamie,” one commenter wrote, according to Us Weekly.

Another friend added: “Holding you and your family close to my heart. Adam will always be a part of you.”
title: Jamie-Lynn Sigler’s brother dies after brain hemorrhage
